comments.text: PSVR2 is my first options for VR due to OLED true blacks , adaptive triggers and haptic feedback with headset rumble at an affordable price! ❤ I am also a trophy hunter. I am optimistic for its future so lets hope for all the best 😊
comments.author: @Man9oorKSA

comments.text: Seeing how amazing No Man's Sky looks, makes me think about all these beautiful sci-fi retro shooters that could've been ported to VR. Halo, Half-Life 2, Deus Ex and especially Unreal. Imagine Facing Worlds map in VR with the music we all love. I'm so crazy about Unreal games I created a documentary on my channel for every game for 25th Anniversary of Unreal Tournament. Over 350 maps, 1TB of footage to edit, 1 year in the making but who can stop us when we love something? :)

comments.text: My first experience into VR was the OG Playstation VR at launch in 2016.  I immediately went out and got an oculus rift and then I have owned many headsets since then.  As soon as I put in the included Demo Disk that came with PSVR I was absolutely hooked forever.  Firewall was the first game in VR that I really dove into and we had a squad that plated together for months.
comments.author: @angrybeaver6667

comments.text: I’ve had all the quest headsets and both ps headsets. My quest 3 broke a few weeks ago, and along with meta being aholes I didn’t want to go back to their products. The psvr 2 on pc is glorious! Zero latency and no compression artifacts. The mura is much less pronounced on pcvr with it. Gaming on ps5 with psvr 2 is great too

comments.text: PSVR2 on PC gang! Games like Metro and HL:A just shine on OLED. You really need those pitch blacks to elevate the unnerving factor. But if you can afford a microoled instead go for it!
comments.author: @MacPanama

comments.text:
I have quest and PSVR2 - of those my PSVR2 is my favorite. I would definitely be interested in your game coming to PSVR2. 
As to what you said about Sony - I was extremely disappointed about state of play and have major hopium that there will be a blog post or a mini show focusing on PSVR2 given we have its 3 year next weekend. Sony does seem to support the device but quietly in the background via throwing money at big external devs about once a year - they pushed hard to secure PSVR2 support for Microsoft flight simulator which should be coming this year.
comments.author: @mattankuda5766
